Yes, If you are a first-time user of Charlotte's public transportation system, here are a few tips to help you get started:

1. Plan ahead: Use the CATS Pass app to plan your route and check the real-time location of buses and light rail. This can help you avoid any unexpected delays or changes in the schedule.

2. Know the fare system: The fare system for CATS buses and light rail can be complex as it depends on the distance traveled and the type of ticket used (single ride, day pass, weekly pass, etc.). Make sure to check the fares on the CATS Pass app, on the CATS website, or at a CATS information center to ensure you have the correct fare and ticket.

3. Be prepared: Bring water, snacks, and anything else you may need for your journey. Also, ensure you have your smartphone charged or bring a portable charger, as you may need to depend on the mobile app during your journey.

4. Give yourself plenty of time: When taking public transportation, it is always best to give yourself plenty of time to reach your destination, especially if you are unfamiliar with the area.

Following these tips should help you feel more confident when using Charlotte's public transportation system for the first time.
